links.title: List all records
links.description:
To list all records, send a GET request to the `/items` endpoint.
The following table contains the list of all the possible arguments, along with their type, description and examples values.
To filter items you can use or `filter[ids]` alone or `filter[type]` in combination with other type of filters.

page[offset].description: index of first record to fetch

version.description: whether you want the currently published versions of your records, or the latest available

links.title: List all the records of a model that link to a specific record

version.description: whether you want the currently published version of the record, or the latest available

item.title: Record
item.description: DatoCMS stores the individual pieces of content you create from a model as records, which are much like table rows in a database. For backward-compatibility reasons, the API refers to records as "items".

attributes.description: The JSON data associated to the record

enumDescription.updated: The record has some unpublished changes

is_valid.description: Whether the current record is valid or not

current_version.description: The ID of the current record version

creator.description: The entity (account/editor/access token) who created the record

links.title: Create a new upload
links.description:
To upload a new asset to a DatoCMS project you will need to perform three separate HTTP calls. This helps DatoCMS making the uploading process extremely fast, as we don't need to be a middleman between you (the user that wants to upload an asset) and the storage bucket.

**We strongly recommend to use our JS or Ruby client to upload new assets**, as they provide helper methods that take care of all the details for you.

http.title: Step 1: Request an upload permission
http.description: First, send a `POST` request to the [`/upload-requests` endpoint](/docs/content-management-api/resources/upload-request/create) to retrieve an AWS pre-signed URL:

http.title: Step 2: Upload file to the storage bucket
http.description: Now you can use the obtained URL to perform a `PUT` request directly to AWS, uploading the raw content of the file as the request body (no multipart upload!):

http.title: Step 3: Create the actual upload (and get back the async job)
http.description: Make a `POST` request to the `/uploads` endpoint with the path being the ID of the request made on step 1.

http.title: Step 4: Retrieve the job result
http.description: You can now poll for the completion of the job that will eventually return your upload object:

js.title: Create an upload
js.description: This example shows how to upload local and remote files.

ruby.title: Create an upload
ruby.description: This example shows how to upload local and remote files.

page[offset].description: Index of first record to fetch

links.title: Update a upload

js.title: Update/rename assets

ruby.title: Update/rename assets
ruby.request:
# frozen_string_literal: true

require "dato"
client = Dato::Site::Client.new("YOUR-API-KEY")

# let's say we have this upload

upload = client.uploads.find("4124")

# we can either update its regular attributes:

client.uploads.update(
  upload.id,
  author: "New author!",
  copyright: "New copyright",
  default_field_metadata: {
    en: {
      alt: "new default alt",
      title: "new default title",
      custom_data: {},
    },
  },
)

# or replace its file

client.uploads.update(
  upload.id,
  path: client.create_upload_path("./image.jpg"),
)

# or rename the file (for SEO purposes)

updated_upload = client.uploads.update(
  upload.id,
  basename: "this-will-be-the-new-file-basename",
)

puts updated_upload.inspect
ruby.response:
# frozen_string_literal: true

{
  id: "4124",
  size: 444,
  width: 30,
  height: 30,
  path: "/45/1496845848-this-will-be-the-new-file-basename.jpg",
  basename: "digital-cats",
  url: "https://www.datocms-assets.com/45/1496845848-this-will-be-the-new-file-basename.jpg",
  format: "jpg",
  author: "New author!",
  copyright: "New copyright",
  notes: "Nyan the cat",
  default_field_metadata: {
    en: {
      alt: "new default alt",
      title: "new default title",
      custom_data: {},
    },
  },
  is_image: true,
  tags: ["cats"],
}

upload.title: Upload
upload.description: Every file you upload to DatoCMS will be retrievable from this endpoint.

duration.description: Seconds of duration for the video

mux_playback_id.description: Public Mux playback ID. Used with stream.mux.com to create the source URL for a video player.

mux_mp4_highest_res.description: Maximum quality of MP4 rendition available

en.title: this is the default title
en.alt: this is the default alternate text

item_type.title: Model
item_type.description: The way you define the kind of content you can edit inside your administrative area passes through the concept of Models, which are much like database tables. For backward-compatibility reasons, the API refers to models as "item types".

collection_appeareance.description: The way the model collection should be presented to the editors
collection_appeareance.deprecated: This field contains a typo and will be removed in future versions: use `collection_appearance` instead

collection_appearance.description: The way the model collection should be presented to the editors

singleton.description: Whether the model is single-instance or not

all_locales_required.description: Whether we require all the project locales to be present for each localized field or not

sortable.description: Whether editors can sort records via drag & drop or not

modular_block.description: Whether this model is a modular content block or not

draft_mode_active.description: Whether draft/published mode is active or not

tree.description: Whether editors can organize records in a tree or not

ordering_direction.description: If an ordering field is set, this fields specify the sorting direction

has_singleton_item.description: If this model is single-instance, this tells the single-instance record has already been created or not

menu_item.description: The menu item instance related to this item type

singleton_item.description: The item instance related to this item type

fields.description: The list of item type fields

title_field.description: The field to use as display title

ordering_field.description: The field upon which the collection is sorted

field.title: Field
field.description: Each Model consists of a set of fields. Using the database metaphore, fields are like table columns, and when creating them you need to specify their type ("string", "image", "float", etc.) and any required validation.

localized.description: Whether the field needs to be multilanguage or not

default_value.description: Default value for Field. When field is localized accepts an object of default values with site locales as keys

hint.example: This field will be used as post title

appeareance.deprecated: This field contains a typo and will be removed in future versions: use `appearance` instead

upload_request.title: Upload permission
upload_request.description: To upload a file in DatoCMS, first you need to obtain an upload permission through this API endpoint. The response will contain the S3 URL where you will be able to upload the file with a direct PUT request.

id.description: The S3 path where the file will be stored

url.description: The URL to use to upload the file with a direct PUT request

attributes.description: The JSON data associated to the item_version

sso_user.title: SSO User
sso_user.description: A Single Sign-On user exists when a DatoCMS project is connected to an external Identity Provider. An SSO user will not use the standard login procedure but has to go through SAML authentication. It can also be linked to one or more IdP groups.

is_active.description: Whether this user is active on the identity provider. De-activated users won't be able to login.

sso_group.title: SSO Group
sso_group.description: A Single Sign-On group exists when a DatoCMS project is connected to an Identity Provider. These groups can be used to link DatoCMS roles to the Identity Provider's groups.

priority.description: When an user belongs to multiple groups, the role associated to the group with the highest priority will be used
